result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelley M. SCHMIDT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelley M. SCHMIDT

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The State moves to amend count 1 to county ordinance disorderly conduct, contrary to Manitowoc County Ordinance 6.19.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted.
The Court imposes a $400.00 forfeiture plus costs, total of $708.50, to be paid by 02-14-16 or 14 days county jail for failure to pay.

Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
With cover letter.
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant; Motion to Suppress Statements of Defendant.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 11-04-15 at 9:30 a.m.   Plea date is set for 12-17-15 at 2:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of disorderly conduct and obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-05-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $450.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, have no contact with Capone's Bar at 1036 S. 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI or any part of their premises and maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
